name: openai
label: OpenAI
description: This integration supports interacting with OpenAI's powerful language model, ChatGPT from FortiSOAR workflows

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: apiKey
fields.description: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform automated operations. For information on how to get an API Key, see https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys.
fields.tooltip: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Organization ID
fields.name: organization
fields.tooltip: Specify the organization ID to access a specific organization.
fields.description: Specify the organization ID to access a specific organization.

fields.title: Project ID
fields.name: project
fields.tooltip: Specify the project name to access a specific project within the organization.
fields.description: Specify the project name to access a specific project within the organization.

fields.title: Use Microsoft Azure OpenAI Endpoint
fields.name: api_type
fields.description: Select this option to use OpenAI services via a Microsoft Azure Endpoint.
fields.tooltip: Select this option to use OpenAI services via a Microsoft Azure Endpoint.

true.title: Endpoint FQHN
true.description: Specify the FQHN of the Azure OpenAI Endpoint to which you want to connect and perform automated operations.
true.tooltip: Specify the FQHN of the Azure OpenAI Endpoint to which you want to connect and perform automated operations.
true.name: api_base

true.title: API Version
true.description: Specify the Azure OpenAI API version to be used for the connection. For example, 2023-05-15
true.tooltip: Specify the Azure OpenAI API version to be used for the connection.
true.name: api_version

true.title: Deployment Name
true.description: Specify the deployment name of Azure OpenAI Deployment Name to be used for the connection.
true.tooltip: Specify the deployment name of Azure OpenAI Deployment Name to be used for the connection.
true.name: deployment_id

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Select this option to verify the SSL certificate for the server.
fields.description: Select this option to verify the SSL certificate for the server. By default, this option is enabled.

operations.title: Ask a Question
operations.description: Generates a contextually relevant response to a given question using a pre-trained deep learning model.

parameters.title: Message
parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Specify the message or question for which you want to generate a response.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the message or question for which you want to generate a response.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the GPT model to use for the chat completion. Currently, only gpt-3.5-turbo and gpt-3.5-turbo-0301 are supported. By default, it is set to gpt-3.5-turbo.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the GPT model to use for the chat completion. Currently, only gpt-3.5-turbo and gpt-3.5-turbo-0301 are supported.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Top Probability
parameters.name: top_p
parameters.description: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or Temperature parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Max Tokens
parameters.name: max_tokens
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. NOTE: The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.
parameters.tooltip: Specify maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. NOTE: The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.

parameters.title: Timeout
parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum time (in seconds) you want to wait for the action to complete successfully. By default it is set to 600 seconds.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum time (in seconds) you want to wait for the action to complete successfully.

parameters.title: Additional Inputs
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: Converse With OpenAI
operations.description: Allows users to converse with OpenAI, i.e., users can ask a question and get the answer from OpenAI based on the previous discussions.

parameters.title: Messages
parameters.name: messages
parameters.description: Specify the list of messages for which you want to generate a chat completion. The OpenAI documentation recommends that you should include all previous chat messages.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the list of messages for which you want to generate a chat completion. The OpenAI documentation recommends that you should include all previous chat messages.
parameters.value: [{"role": "user", "content": "when was stuxnet first seen"},{"role": "assistant", "content": "Stuxnet was first identified by the infosec community in 2010, but development on it probably began in 20051. I hope this helps!"},{"role": "user", "content": "who discovered it"}]

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the GPT model to use for the chat completion. Currently, only gpt-3.5-turbo and gpt-3.5-turbo-0301 are supported. By default, it is set to gpt-3.5-turbo.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the GPT model to use for the chat completion. Currently, only gpt-3.5-turbo and gpt-3.5-turbo-0301 are supported. By default, it is set to gpt-3.5-turbo.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Top Probability
parameters.name: top_p
parameters.description: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Max Tokens
parameters.name: max_tokens
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. NOTE: The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. NOTE: The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.

parameters.title: Timeout
parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum time (in seconds) you want to wait for the action to complete successfully. By default it is set to 600 seconds.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum time (in seconds) you want to wait for the action to complete successfully.

parameters.title: Additional Inputs
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: List Available Models
operations.description: Retrieves a list and descriptions of all models available in the OpenAI API.

operations.title: Get Tokens Usage
operations.description: Retrieves the usage details for each OpenAI API call for the specified date.

parameters.title: Date
parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Select the date for which you want to retrieve usage data for each OpenAI API call.
parameters.tooltip: Select the date for which you want to retrieve usage data for each OpenAI API call.

operations.title: Get Token Count
operations.description: Counts the number of tokens in the specified string and OpenAI model.

parameters.title: Input Text
parameters.name: input_text
parameters.description: Specify the text input, i.e., the string for which you want to evaluate the token count.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text input, i.e., the string for which you want to evaluate the token count.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The OpenAI model using which you want to evaluate the token count. Specify the ID of the OpenAI model to use for the evaluation of token count. By default, this parameter is set to gpt-4.
parameters.tooltip: The OpenAI model using which you want to evaluate the token count. Specify the ID of the OpenAI model to use for the evaluation of token count.

operations.title: Create Assistant
operations.description: Creates an assistant based on specified input parameters.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the ID of model to be used to create an assistant. You can use the "List Available Models" action to see all of your available models.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of model to be used to create an assistant. You can use the "List Available Models" action to see all of your available models.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the name of assistant to be created
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of assistant to be created

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Specify the description of assistant to be created.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the description of assistant to be created.

parameters.title: Instructions
parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: Specify the system instructions that the assistant uses
parameters.tooltip: Specify the system instructions that the assistant uses

parameters.title: Tools
parameters.name: tools
parameters.description: Specify a list tools enable on assistant. There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types code_interpreter, file_search, or function. For example,
parameters.tooltip: Specify a list tools enable on assistant. There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types code_interpreter, file_search, or function

parameters.title: Tool Resources
parameters.name: tool_resources
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tools.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Top Probability
parameters.name: top_p
parameters.description: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long. For example, {
            "creator": "Jane Doe",
            "creation_date": "2024-05-28",
            "purpose": "Customer support",
            "organization": "ABC Inc.",
            "project_id": "123456789",
            "department": "Customer Service",
            "version": "1.0",
            "tags": [
              "customer support",
              "AI assistant",
              "version 1.0"
            ]
          }
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

operations.title: List Assistants
operations.description: Retrieves a list of assistants.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Select the order in which to retrieve the assistant list sorted by creation time. You can choose from Ascending or Descending.
parameters.tooltip: Select the order in which to retrieve the assistant list sorted by creation time.

parameters.title: Starting ID
parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Specify the assistant ID to retrieve assistants after this ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the assistant ID to retrieve assistants after this ID.

parameters.title: Ending ID
parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Specify the assistant ID to retrieve assistants before this ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the assistant ID to retrieve assistants before this ID.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of items to be retrieved. By default it retrieves 20.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items to be retrieved. By default it retrieves 20.

operations.title: Get Assistant Details
operations.description: Retrieves an assistant based on assistant ID.

parameters.title: Assistant ID
parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of assistant to be retrieved
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of assistant to be retrieved

operations.title: Delete Assistant
operations.description: Deletes an assistant based on assistant ID.

parameters.title: Assistant ID
parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of assistant to be deleted
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of assistant to be deleted

operations.title: Create Thread
operations.description: Creates a thread based on the specified input parameters.

parameters.title: Messages
parameters.name: messages
parameters.tooltip: Specify the list of messages to start the thread.

parameters.title: Tool Resources
parameters.name: tool_resources
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of resources are made available to the assistant's tools in this thread. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the code_interpreter tool requires a list of file IDs, while the file_search tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long. For example, {
            "creator": "Jane Doe",
            "creation_date": "2024-05-28",
            "purpose": "Customer support",
            "organization": "ABC Inc.",
            "project_id": "123456789",
            "department": "Customer Service",
            "version": "1.0",
            "tags": [
              "customer support",
              "AI assistant",
              "version 1.0"
            ]
          }
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

operations.title: Create Thread Message
operations.description: Creates a message based on the specified input parameters.

parameters.title: Thread ID
parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the thread to create a message for.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the thread to create a message for.

parameters.title: Role
parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Specify the role of entity that is creating the message. You can choose from User, Assistant
parameters.tooltip: Specify the role of entity that is creating the message.

parameters.title: Content
parameters.name: content

text.value: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the message content in list format. Message content can be of type text, image_url or image_file.

parameters.title: Attachments
parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: Specify the list of files attached to the message, and the tools they should be added to.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the list of files attached to the message, and the tools they should be added to.

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long. For example, {
            "creator": "Jane Doe",
            "creation_date": "2024-05-28",
            "purpose": "Customer support",
            "organization": "ABC Inc.",
            "project_id": "123456789",
            "department": "Customer Service",
            "version": "1.0",
            "tags": [
              "customer support",
              "AI assistant",
              "version 1.0"
            ]
          }
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

operations.title: List Thread Messages
operations.description: Retrieves a list of messages for specified thread based on the specified input parameters.

parameters.title: Thread ID
parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the thread whose messages are to retrieved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the thread whose messages are to retrieved.

parameters.title: Run ID
parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the run generated for the messages to be retrieved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the run generated for the messages to be retrieved.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Select the order in which to retrieve the message list sorted by creation time. You can choose from Ascending or Descending.
parameters.tooltip: Select the order in which to retrieve the message list sorted by creation time.

parameters.title: Starting ID
parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Specify the message ID to retrieve messages after this ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the message ID to retrieve messages after this ID.

parameters.title: Ending ID
parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Specify the message ID to retrieve messages before this ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the message ID to retrieve messages before this ID.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of items to be retrieved. By default it retrieves 20.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items to be retrieved. By default it retrieves 20.

operations.title: Get Thread Message Details
operations.description: Retrieves a specific message based on Thread ID and Message ID.

parameters.title: Thread ID

parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the thread whose message is to be retrieved.

parameters.title: Message ID
parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the message to be retrieved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the message to be retrieved.

operations.title: Delete Thread Message
operations.description: Deletes a message based on Thread ID and Message ID.

parameters.title: Thread ID
parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the thread whose message is to be deleted.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the thread whose message is to be deleted.

parameters.title: Message ID
parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the message to be deleted.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the message to be deleted.

operations.title: Create Run
operations.description: Creates a run based on specified input parameters.

parameters.title: Thread ID
parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of thread for which run is to be created.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of thread for which run is to be created.

parameters.title: Assistant ID
parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of assistant to use to execute this run.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of assistant to use to execute this run.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the ID of model to be used to execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used. You can use the "List Available Models" action to see all of your available models.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of model to be used to create a run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used. You can use the "List Available Models" action to see all of your available models.

parameters.title: Instructions
parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: Specify the system instructions that the assistant uses. Overrides the instructions of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the system instructions that the run uses. Overrides the instructions of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

parameters.title: Additional Instructions
parameters.name: additional_instructions
parameters.description: Specify the additional instructions that the assistant uses after the assistant instruction. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis without overriding other instructions.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the additional instructions that the run uses after the assistant instruction. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis without overriding other instructions.

parameters.title: Additional Messages
parameters.name: additional_messages

parameters.title: Tools
parameters.name: tools
parameters.description: Specify a list tools assistant can use for this run. Overrides the tools of the assistant if provided. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a list tools assistant can use for this run. Overrides the tools of the assistant if provided. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Top Probability
parameters.name: top_p
parameters.description: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long. For example, {
            "creator": "Jane Doe",
            "creation_date": "2024-05-28",
            "purpose": "Customer support",
            "organization": "ABC Inc.",
            "project_id": "123456789",
            "department": "Customer Service",
            "version": "1.0",
            "tags": [
              "customer support",
              "AI run",
              "version 1.0"
            ]
          }
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

parameters.title: Max Prompt Tokens
parameters.name: max_prompt_tokens
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of prompt tokens  that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status incomplete. See incomplete_details for more info.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of prompt tokens  that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status incomplete. See incomplete_details for more info.

parameters.title: Additional Inputs
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: List Runs
operations.description: Retrieves a list of runs belonging to a thread.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of thread whose runs are to be retrieved
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of thread whose runs are to be retrieved

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Select the order in which to retrieve the run list sorted by creation time. You can choose from Ascending or Descending.
parameters.tooltip: Select the order in which to retrieve the run list sorted by creation time.

parameters.title: Starting ID
parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Specify the run ID to retrieve runs after this ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the run ID to retrieve runs after this ID.

parameters.title: Ending ID
parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Specify the run ID to retrieve runs before this ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the run ID to retrieve runs before this ID.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of items to be retrieved. By default it retrieves 20.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items to be retrieved. By default it retrieves 20.

operations.title: Get Run Details
operations.description: Retrieves a specific run for a thread.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of run to be retrieved

operations.title: Create Thread and Run
operations.description: Creates a thread and run in one request.

parameters.title: Assistant ID
parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of assistant to use to execute this run.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of assistant to use to execute this run.

parameters.title: Thread
parameters.name: thread
parameters.tooltip: Specify the thread object to create and run.

messages.content: Explain deep learning to a 5 year old.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the ID of model to be used to execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used. You can use the "List Available Models" action to see all of your available models.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of model to be used to create a run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used. You can use the "List Available Models" action to see all of your available models.

parameters.title: Instructions
parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: Specify the system instructions that the assistant uses. Overrides the instructions of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the system instructions that the run uses. Overrides the instructions of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

parameters.title: Tools
parameters.name: tools
parameters.description: Specify a list tools assistant can use for this run. Overrides the tools of the assistant if provided. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a list tools assistant can use for this run. Overrides the tools of the assistant if provided. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

parameters.title: Tool Resources
parameters.name: tool_resources
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tools.

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long. For example, {
            "creator": "Jane Doe",
            "creation_date": "2024-05-28",
            "purpose": "Customer support",
            "organization": "ABC Inc.",
            "project_id": "123456789",
            "department": "Customer Service",
            "version": "1.0",
            "tags": [
              "customer support",
              "AI run",
              "version 1.0"
            ]
          }
parameters.tooltip: Specify the set of 16 key-value pairs for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature between 0 and 2. Higher values, such as, 0.8 make the output more random, while lower values make the output more focused and deterministic. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Top Probability' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Top Probability
parameters.name: top_p
parameters.description: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both. By default, this parameter is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the top probability, an alternative to sampling with temperature, also called nucleus sampling. The model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. NOTE: It is recommended to use either this parameter or the 'Temperature' parameter, not both.

parameters.title: Max Prompt Tokens
parameters.name: max_prompt_tokens
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of prompt tokens  that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status incomplete. See incomplete_details for more info.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of prompt tokens  that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status incomplete. See incomplete_details for more info.

operations.title: Create Speech
operations.description: Generates audio from the input text.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Select the text to search model.
parameters.tooltip: Select the text to search model. You can choose TTS-1 or TTS-1 HD

parameters.title: Input
parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Specify the text to generate audio for. The maximum length is 4096 characters.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text to generate audio for. The maximum length is 4096 characters.

parameters.title: Voice
parameters.name: voice
parameters.description: Select the voice to use when generating the audio. Supported voices are Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, Nova, and Shimmer
parameters.tooltip: Select the voice to use when generating the audio.

parameters.title: File Path
parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: Specify the path or the filename where you want to save the audio.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the path or the filename where you want to save the audio.

parameters.title: Audio Format
parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description: Specify the audio format in which you want to get the generated audio. By default it is set to mp3.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the audio format in which you want to get the generated audio.

parameters.title: Speed
parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Specify the speed of the generated audio. Select a value from 0.25 to 4.0. By default it is set to 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the speed of the generated audio. Select a value from 0.25 to 4.0.

operations.title: Create Transcription
operations.description: Transcribes audio into the input language.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the tID of the model to use. Only whisper-1 (which is powered by our open source Whisper V2 model) is currently available.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the model to use.

parameters.title: File
parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The audio file to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.
parameters.tooltip: The audio file to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.

parameters.title: Language
parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Specify the language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format will improve accuracy and latency.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.

parameters.title: Prompt
parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: Specify the optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

parameters.title: Timestamp Granularities
parameters.name: timestamp_granularities
parameters.description: Select the timestamp granularities for the transcription. Note: Generating word timestamps incurs additional latency. You can choose either or both from Word, Segment
parameters.tooltip: Select the timestamp granularities for the transcription. Note: Generating word timestamps incurs additional latency.

operations.title: Create Translation
operations.description: Translates audio into English.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the model to use. Only whisper-1 (which is powered by our open source Whisper V2 model) is currently available.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the model to use.

parameters.title: File
parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The audio file to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.
parameters.tooltip: The audio file to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.

parameters.title: Prompt
parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: Specify the optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.

parameters.title: Temperature
parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Specify the sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

operations.title: Upload File
operations.description: Uploads a file that can be used in various actions. Individual files can be up to 512 MB, and the size of all files uploaded by one organization can be up to 100 GB.

parameters.title: File
parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded.
parameters.tooltip: The file to be uploaded.

parameters.title: Purpose
parameters.name: purpose
parameters.description: Select the intended purpose of the uploaded file. You can choose from "Assistants", "Vision", "Batch", "Fine-tune", or "User Data". For Vision, supported file types are "gif", "jpeg", "jpg", "png", and "webp". For Fine-tuning, only .jsonl files are supported with specific formats for chat or completions models. For Batch, only .jsonl files up to 100 MB are supported with a specific format.
parameters.tooltip: Select the intended purpose of the uploaded file.For Vision, supported file types are "gif", "jpeg", "jpg", "png", and "webp". For Fine-tuning, only .jsonl files are supported with specific formats for chat or completions models. For Batch, only .jsonl files up to 100 MB are supported with a specific format.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the role of content.
parameters.description: Specify the role of content.
